texto: I am reduced to a thing that wants Virginia. I composed a beautiful letter to you in the sleepless nightmare hours of the night, and it has all gone: I just miss you, in a quite simple desperate human way.

It is incredible how essential to me you have become. I suppose you are accustomed to people saying these things. Damn you, spoilt creature; I shan’t make you love me any the more by giving myself away like this.

But oh my dear, I can’t be clever and stand-offish with you: I love you too much for that. Too truly. You have no idea how stand-offish I can be with people I don’t love. I have brought it to a fine art. But you have broken down my defences.
I have missed you. I do miss you. I shall miss you. And if you don’t believe it, you’re a long-eared owl and ass.

I really curse and damn at the pain of it — and yet I wouldn’t be without it for anything... Oh damn it, Virginia, I wish I didn’t love you so much. No I don’t though; that’s not true. I am glad I do.
Yes yes yes I do like you. I am afraid to write the stronger word.
I just send you my love, unsquashable.
The wish to steal Virginia overcomes me, — steal her, take her away, and put her in the sun...
I’m settling down to wanting you, doggedly, dismally, faithfully.
Ah, but I like being with Vita.
I have walked on air all day since getting your letter. I am more pleased than I can tell you at your approval... I felt like a stroked cat.
It’s odd how I want you when I’m ill. I think everything would be warm and happy if Vita came in.
Do be good, strong-minded, self protective. I hate it when you get tired and droop. It really hurts me. Bless you, sweet.
When I read you, I feel no one has ever written English prose before... I wonder perpetually how you do it.
My silly Virginia. My darling, darling, precious Virginia.
There’s only one person I want to see, and she has no burning wish for anything but a rose red tower and a view of hop gardens and oasts. Who can it be?
I have just found your letter... It made me so happy that I turned into a firework and went up, in a shower of sparks, and have only just come down again, very singed and blackened, to write this.
My (once) Virginia... Just because you choose to sit in the mud in Kent and I on the flags of London, that’s no reason why love should fade, is it?
You know I love you, and you know I like Leonard. There is a difference between love and like. So you are my love and Leonard is my like. I do like Leonard extremely.
I like the battlements in the moonlight and the frost. You will stay over Tuesday night, won't you? ... I suppose I can manage to exist until Monday but I’m not sure.
Style is a very simple matter, it is all rhythm. Once you get that, you can't use the wrong words.
I try to invent you for myself, but find I really have only 2 twigs and 3 straws to do it with.
But I like it less when I read that you have been ill for a week. It makes me feel guilty for every moment that I have spent, hearty and well.
It is a sensation I get only from you. It is physically stimulating, restful at the same time.
I am blind. Blinded by diamonds... I have been in Aladdin's cave. Sacks of emeralds were emptied out before our eyes.
I want to take you over the water meadows in the summer on foot, I have thought of many million things to tell you. Devil that you are, to vanish to Persia and leave me here!
Do you know, it was my native modesty which prevented me from sending you my book. I couldn’t believe you really wanted it.
I will never dine out again. I will burn my evening dress. I have gone through this door. Nothing exists beyond... I sacrificed an evening alone with Vita... an evening of pleasure.
After all, what is a lovely phrase? One that has mopped up as much Truth as it can hold.
I am so glad that you are happy. I am so glad that you are working. I am so glad that you love me.
